Heist.synopsis: The player finds Rakath Glitterbeard, head banker, and his cronies gathered around a chest congratulating one another on a trap well-sprung. The chest is a mimic, which they've used to capture and kill the crime boss The Stone Lord - or so they believe.The mimic bursts apart from the inside to reveal that the Stone Lord is none other than Minsc - and he's in the thrall of the Absolute. A doppelganger cultist is imitating his old friend Jaheira in an attempt to control him.

AD_HeadClerkOfficeGuard_CombatStart.synopsis: AD played by the guard when it starts combat with players who are trespassing

AD_PrivateGuard_03_Idle.synopsis: Idle AD for Rakath's private guard that is played as part of his/her behavior in case of surviing the combat with the cultists

VaultGuard.synopsis: The player approaches the vault guard and is asked to present their bank pass.

AD_Guard_11_Patrol.synopsis: AD that the guard does while patrolling one of the ships in the docks area of the Counting House.

AD_LobbyCheckpointGuards_Convo.synopsis: Idle conversation between guards who are positioned at the lobby checkpoint of the Counting House

Guard_03_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Jacko
Guard_03_0.text: If you need help, saer, just speak to the clerks.

AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultUnlocked_0.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultUnlocked_0.text: Why don't I just bloody give you the keys, eh? You can take my office.
AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultUnlocked_0.context: NodeContext: Sarcastically accomodating - we're still rifling around in the vaults right in front of you

AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultUnlocked_1.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultUnlocked_1.text: Another, is it? Good on you, mate.
AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultUnlocked_1.context: NodeContext: Eyebrows raised, a little disbelieving that we're still robbing the place right in front of you, but bitterly channeling 'fuck it, go on'

AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultUnlocked_2.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultUnlocked_2.text: What do you think you're - oh, go on. What bloody difference does it make?
AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultUnlocked_2.context: NodeContext: The player is opening a vault right in front of you, you're about to complain but there's just been an even bigger robbery and you've lost the ability to give a shit.

AD_LobbyStairsGuard_Idle_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Theoda
AD_LobbyStairsGuard_Idle_0.text: Beshaba's black bones - a thief, an alarm, anything to pass the bloody time.

AD_LobbyStairsGuard_Idle_2.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Theoda
AD_LobbyStairsGuard_Idle_2.text: Days like this almost make me miss the merchant train.

AD_Civilian_04_Annoyed_0.speaker: Gilla Merrun
AD_Civilian_04_Annoyed_0.text: I think you should know my son is a very important Flaming Fist.

AD_Civilian_04_Annoyed_1.speaker: Gilla Merrun
AD_Civilian_04_Annoyed_1.text: I'm sure your personal affairs are very important, but I have business to transact!

AD_Civilian_04_Annoyed_2.speaker: Gilla Merrun
AD_Civilian_04_Annoyed_2.text: Could I get some service? I'm right here.

AD_Guard_13_Idle_0.speaker: Cashguard Basher Humgoole
AD_Guard_13_Idle_0.text: Got to make that rent money back or Gladiss will kill me.

AD_Guard_13_Idle_1.speaker: Cashguard Basher Humgoole
AD_Guard_13_Idle_1.text: Maybe I can take Yonni's shift for her, work some extra time.

AD_Guard_13_Idle_2.speaker: Cashguard Basher Humgoole
AD_Guard_13_Idle_2.text: Shouldn't have bet the rent on that dice throw. What was I thinking?

AD_PinCodeSign_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PinCodeSign_0.text: *For current door codes please refer to the Head Banker's office. Highest security clearance only.*

AD_Guard_04_CombatStart_0.speaker: Cashguard Dugg
AD_Guard_04_CombatStart_0.text: You messed with the wrong cashguard, trespasser!

AD_HeadBankerOfficeGuard_Alarm_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Faona
AD_HeadBankerOfficeGuard_Alarm_0.context: NodeContext: You've just spotted an intrustion / infraction in the vaults

SwD_HeadBanker_16.speaker: Narrator
SwD_HeadBanker_16.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

SwD_HeadBanker_8.speaker: Player
SwD_HeadBanker_8.text: What was all that with the mimic?

SwD_HeadBanker_0.speaker: Player
SwD_HeadBanker_0.text: What did the cult want with all that gold?

SwD_HeadBanker_1.speaker: Player
SwD_HeadBanker_1.text: What can you tell me about the Stone Lord?

SwD_HeadBanker_4.speaker: Player
SwD_HeadBanker_4.text: How can I open the private vaults?

SwD_HeadBanker_20.speaker: Narrator
SwD_HeadBanker_20.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

SwD_HeadBanker_22.speaker: Narrator
SwD_HeadBanker_22.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

PrivateGuard_02_0.speaker: Cashguard Basher Edvidge
PrivateGuard_02_0.text: ...I hope this won't affect my bonus?
PrivateGuard_02_0.context: NodeContext: Guard after a fight in which the bank vault was breached.

PrivateGuard_02_1.speaker: Cashguard Basher Edvidge
PrivateGuard_02_1.text: First time the vaults have been breached the entire time I've worked here.

VaultButtonGuard_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Smathers
VaultButtonGuard_0.text: Mind your manners down here, saer. Titles don't mean much once you're in the vault.

AD_PrivateGuard_02_Idle_0.speaker: Cashguard Basher Edvidge
AD_PrivateGuard_02_Idle_0.text: Bloody better not be coming out of my wages.

AD_PrivateGuard_02_Idle_1.speaker: Cashguard Basher Edvidge
AD_PrivateGuard_02_Idle_1.text: Maybe Nina still needs a crack-skull. Less drama working in a bloody festhall.

AD_PrivateGuard_02_Idle_2.speaker: Cashguard Basher Edvidge
AD_PrivateGuard_02_Idle_2.text: Just... breathe. Breathe. Then switch bloody jobs.

AD_Guard_07_Patrol_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Heen
AD_Guard_07_Patrol_0.text: Don't like patrolling? Don't join the cashguards!

AD_Guard_07_Patrol_1.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Heen
AD_Guard_07_Patrol_1.text: No patrol, no control, that's what I say.

AD_Guard_07_Patrol_2.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Heen
AD_Guard_07_Patrol_2.text: Some don't take patrolling seriously, but they're wrong.

HeadBanker_0.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_0.text: I hope you've come to make a lodgement. A city-sized one.

HeadBanker_29.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_29.text: You lost innocent people's money. The Guild ought to swallow some of that cost.

HeadBanker_35.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_35.context: NodeContext: Snort of pure derision - we just suggested he personally cover some of the bank's losses

HeadBanker_131.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_131.text: Oh. You're serious. Maybe you don't have a head for accounting, but that's... not quite how the numbers work.

HeadBanker_110.speaker: Minsc
HeadBanker_110.text: These large numbers, they wrinkle Minsc's brow and bring a soreness to his skull. Make them smaller, please.
HeadBanker_110.context: NodeContext: Air of friendly threat. You're intimidating a corrupt banker to eat some of his own losses before you'll agree to retrieve his stolen coin.

HeadBanker_60.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_60.text: I'd listen to him. Before his hamster has to give him a head rub.

HeadBanker_59.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_59.text: Minsc has no use for such large numbers. As with my hamster, smaller would be better.

HeadBanker_62.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_62.text: Hamster...? But - look, I can't. The losses -
HeadBanker_62.context: NodeContext: Confused, exasperated, but ultimately relenting

HeadBanker_100.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_100.text: I... wish I could help you, Stone Lord. I really do. But it's just the economy, yeah?
HeadBanker_100.context: NodeContext: Wary, doesn't want to get beaten over it, but it's just not in him to bring the number down. He can't even explain it so just gestures vaguely at 'the economy'.

HeadBanker_93.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_93.text: You're not going to have much of a head for numbers if I crack it open.

HeadBanker_102.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_102.text: I'm trying to hire you, and you're extorting me - with a dash of violence on top. Might be you have a future in the Guild.

HeadBanker_19.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_19.text: Do it, then. Won't put bread on anyone's table, if that's what you actually care about.

HeadBanker_28.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_28.text: The heist on Manycoins bank in Neverwinter. Ring a bell?

HeadBanker_107.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_107.text: Aye. The Head Banker was beaten to death by a mob, on the rumour she'd taken a cut from the robbers. You... wouldn't stoop to spreading rumours now, would you...?
HeadBanker_107.context: NodeContext: Warily recalling an old story he heard that we're using to threaten him.

HeadBanker_88.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_88.text: Fine. I'll pull in some debts with the other Guild kingpins - I can cover maybe half of what's lost.
HeadBanker_88.context: NodeContext: Frustrated sigh as you relent - you're being extorted and you have no choice.

HeadBanker_16.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_16.text: But I need something back, understand? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

HeadBanker_39.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_39.text: But that's why I pay my guards so well - to keep me well looked-after.

HeadBanker_72.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_72.text: A lot of people will suffer. You can be the one who did that to them, or you can be the one who helped.

HeadBanker_45.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_45.text: Oh, enough. Should I wash the feet of every beggar down by the docks, too?
HeadBanker_45.context: NodeContext: Doesn't want to hear any more of our bleeding heart nonsense, relenting just to make us stop

HeadBanker_104.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_104.text: Or you can be the one to return all that money, and get a nice, shiny reward in return.

HeadBanker_86.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_86.text: So come back when you have it, aye?

HeadBanker_84.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_84.text: Not my coin. That of every common mucker in Baldur's Gate.

HeadBanker_85.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_85.text: Let's me and you make sure they don't all wake up as paupers tomorrow, hm?

HeadBanker_99.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_99.text: Me too, I suppose, because I'm not even tempted to scam you. Take this vault key - you'll find something by way of thanks inside.

HeadBanker_96.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_96.text: This should be the part where I reward you... but looks like someone's nicked my key. Eh... consider this your one-time permission to crack the vault open. But if anyone asks, I never said it.

HeadBanker_8.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_8.text: Here's the coin that was taken. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

HeadBanker_103.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_103.text: And not even a whisker light. Gods, you're a boring bastard. A beautiful bastard! Sir.
HeadBanker_103.context: NodeContext: Amazed we didn't steal anything, falling into patter, realising we're Minsc and scrambling to correct himself lamely

HeadBanker_135.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_135.text: And not even a whisker light. Gods, you're a boring bastard.

HeadBanker_14.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_14.text: You can tell Nine-Fingers - this was not my fault. She swore that mimic could swallow a bloody owlbear.

HeadBanker_54.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_54.text: Wait - you're no Guild-sworn. Who are you?

HeadBanker_11.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_11.text: What was that about your guards turning cultist?

HeadBanker_22.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_22.text: Aye, my own sword-arms. Loyal to the Guild, but more importantly - loyal to me.
HeadBanker_22.context: NodeContext: Referring to the guards who just turned on him - they were taken in by the cult (but in actual fact, tadpoled)

HeadBanker_71.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_71.text: Never knew them to be god-botherers. But we've sent them to be with their precious Absolute now - good riddance.
HeadBanker_71.context: NodeContext: Referring to the guards who just turned on him - they were taken in by the cult (but in actual fact, tadpoled)

HeadBanker_127.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_127.text: Now, respectfully and all that bollocks - I asked who you are.
HeadBanker_127.context: NodeContext: Getting us back on track, not that respectfully at all

HeadBanker_116.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_116.text: The person who just saved your life. A little gratitude wouldn't go amiss.

HeadBanker_49.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_49.text: Gratitude of the gold variety, I suppose you mean? Good luck with that.

HeadBanker_65.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_65.text: The Stone Lord just cleared our vaults - and now he has enough gold to make himself a lord in truth.

HeadBanker_15.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_15.text: I came to stop you and save Minsc. Seems there was no need.

HeadBanker_89.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_89.text: Friend to the mad Rashemaar, are you? He calls himself the Stone Lord now.

HeadBanker_38.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_38.text: With what he cleared from our vaults, he's got enough gold to make himself a lord in truth.

HeadBanker_108.speaker: Jaheira
HeadBanker_108.text: And he wouldn't even know what to spend it on. It's the cult that needs that money - why?

HeadBanker_98.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_98.text: You think anyone told me? Nine-Fingers sent word the Stone Lord was going to try his luck on our vaults. So she told me to cooperate - lure him in.
HeadBanker_98.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, not being particularly helpful

HeadBanker_31.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_31.text: 'Yes sir, Stone Lord, sir. Shall we open the account in your name, or the Absolute's? Just step this way to your special deposit box - don't mind the teeth.'
HeadBanker_31.context: NodeContext: Mock-polite and helpful tone, describing how he played along in an effort to trick the stone lord. 'Don't mind the teeth' is a reference the chest they tricked Minsc into - a mimic.

HeadBanker_97.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_97.text: No one mentioned he might have some old crone dropping in as backup.
HeadBanker_97.context: NodeContext: Back to annoyed and defensive voice

HeadBanker_12.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_12.text: Eh, look, I just mean to say - we both want him caught. If you've got your sights set on the Stone Lord anyway...
HeadBanker_12.context: NodeContext: He accidentally referred to Jaheira as a crone and is backing off a little, doesn't want to piss her off

HeadBanker_130.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_130.text: As chairman of the Fellowship of Financiers, I can assure you we'd reward you well for the return of the coin he took.

HeadBanker_57.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_57.text: Not for us, you understand. For the common Baldurian. Who knows what he's planning to do with it?

HeadBanker_23.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_23.text: Try all of it. Every penny of civilian lodgings, anyway. Not like we'd lead him into the private vaults. But, still - lot of Baldurians waking up poor tomorrow.
HeadBanker_23.context: NodeContext: 'Not like we'd let him...' part is a snort of derision at the idea of letting anyone steal their wealthy customers gold.

HeadBanker_61.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_61.text: What he can do with that kind of coin... doesn't bear thinking about.

HeadBanker_52.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_52.text: Say I find the money. What's to stop me keeping it for myself?

HeadBanker_63.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_63.text: Compassion for your fellow folk? Or maybe just good sense - that much money only paints a target on your back.

HeadBanker_5.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_5.text: In our hands, it keeps this city ticking over. Stock in merchants' stalls, food in hungry bellies.

HeadBanker_33.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_33.text: Retrieve the coin, and I'll make sure you are well rewarded. There's treasures greater than gold.

HeadBanker_41.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_41.text: Feel free to poke around this place if it'll help you pick up the Stone Lord's scent. Me - I've got ledgers to amend.
HeadBanker_41.context: NodeContext: Closing the topic, wants to get back to business

HeadBanker_91.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_91.text: Maybe I'll just tell Nine-Fingers about your failure here instead.

HeadBanker_30.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_30.text: Maybe you do. Gets me a beating, and gets you exactly nothing.

HeadBanker_7.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_7.text: I just need to find Minsc. I care nothing for coin.

HeadBanker_125.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_125.text: Good for you. I happen to care a very great deal.

HeadBanker_2.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_2.text: What does the cult want with that much money?

HeadBanker_24.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_24.text: I don't care about the coin. I just need to know where he went.

HeadBanker_6.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_6.text: Funny, that. I don't give a damn about him, but I care very much where the coin went.

HeadBanker_106.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_106.text: You saw what he did to that mimic, aye? Would you take him head-on if you thought you could just play along instead?
HeadBanker_106.context: NodeContext: Won't have his plan questioned - it was better than a direct fight

HeadBanker_82.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_82.text: Security consultant. Your vaults leave a little to be desired.

HeadBanker_51.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_51.text: You're missing your motley, jester. We softened our defences to lure that bastard in. Nine-Fingers wants the Stone Lord dead.

HeadBanker_120.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_120.text: Our cunning trap just got flipped arse-ways up, is what. Nine-Fingers wants the Stone Lord dead.

HeadBanker_90.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_90.text: A thief - one who could strip you of every copper if I so chose.

HeadBanker_21.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_21.text: You're a little late, master bandit.
HeadBanker_21.context: NodeContext: Dry - not impressed by our boast of being a master thief

HeadBanker_66.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_66.text: Those conniving little shits. My own guards, turned cultist? I pay better than any bloody Absolute.

HeadBanker_105.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_105.text: And you - you're no Guild-sworn. Who are you?

HeadBanker_68.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_68.text: Wait - you. What in Shar's shitting shadows have you come back for?
HeadBanker_68.context: NodeContext: Sudden shock, fear masked by anger - player is using Minsc to speak to Rakath. Last time they met, Minsc almost killed Rakath.

HeadBanker_114.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_114.text: You have been the subject of many wrinkled brows between my hamster and I, Saer Banker-Beard.

HeadBanker_42.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_42.text: On the one hand, you are clearly evil, and deserving of a mouthful of righteous knuckle.

HeadBanker_79.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_79.text: But on the other hand - the one in which Boo sits, and pleads your case - at the time of our last meeting, Minsc was the evil one.

HeadBanker_119.speaker: Player
HeadBanker_119.text: So. We are not agreed on whether we will return here and feed you to a mimic - yet.

HeadBanker_13.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_13.text: I see. Well. By all means... keep me up to date. If you do come back - feel free to bring that coin you took...?
HeadBanker_13.context: NodeContext: Scared shitless but pretending to be reasonably debating the point with Minsc. Last bit about gold is a last-ditch gambit

HeadBanker_128.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_128.text: I see. Well. By all means... keep me up to date.

HeadBanker_73.speaker: Minsc
HeadBanker_73.text: You have been the subject of many wrinkled brows between my hamster and I, Saer Banker-Beard.

HeadBanker_20.speaker: Minsc
HeadBanker_20.text: On the one hand, you are clearly evil, and deserving of a mouthful of righteous knuckle.

HeadBanker_27.speaker: Minsc
HeadBanker_27.text: But on the other hand - the one in which Boo sits, and pleads your case - at the time of our last meeting, Minsc was the evil one.

HeadBanker_32.speaker: Minsc
HeadBanker_32.text: So. We are not agreed on whether we will return here and feed you to a mimic - yet.

HeadBanker_101.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_101.text: Saer Stone Lord. Minsc. Any... progress on that gold?
HeadBanker_101.context: NodeContext: Scared shitless but hoping against hope Minsc has returned the gold

HeadBanker_133.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
HeadBanker_133.text: Now the guildmaster needn't skin me for a pair of boots. Though she still might like to.

AD_HeadBanker_Idle_0.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
AD_HeadBanker_Idle_0.text: What the hells, it's all funny money in the end anyway.

AD_HeadBanker_Idle_1.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
AD_HeadBanker_Idle_1.text: Wait a minute, though - I could shift next year's interest to this year.

AD_HeadBanker_Idle_2.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
AD_HeadBanker_Idle_2.text: These ledgers are never going to balance. I'm a dead man.

Civilian_01_0.speaker: Skonal Dehann
Civilian_01_0.text: Why the hells are they so slow? Meadhoney usually runs a tighter ship than this.

Civilian_01_1.speaker: Skonal Dehann
Civilian_01_1.text: The Head Banker hasn't even come out to help. This is not service.

LobbyStairsGuard_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Theoda
LobbyStairsGuard_0.text: Wouldn't loiter too long here, saer. Makes the guards nervous.

LobbyStairsGuard_1.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Theoda
LobbyStairsGuard_1.context: NodeContext: Polite guard politely trying to get rid of us.

AD_VaultMainGuard_CombatStart_0.speaker: Cashguard Basher Nickelow
AD_VaultMainGuard_CombatStart_0.context: NodeContext: Spotting player, crying out before combat.

VaultWarningGuard_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Dadger
VaultWarningGuard_0.text: Steer clear of the other crowd below, if I may. Don't think I'd trust them around an open vault.

VaultWarningGuard_1.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Dadger
VaultWarningGuard_1.text: Talk to the other one. He's the ranking officer, apparently.

VaultWarningGuard_2.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Dadger
VaultWarningGuard_2.text: Talk to the other one. I'm just paid to stand glower. And not very well, at that.

HeadClerk_34.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_34.text: Ah - if you don't mind, saer, I do believe our business is quite concluded, and I have other customers.
HeadClerk_34.context: NodeContext: Politely trying to fob us off

HeadClerk_42.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_42.text: Ah - if you don't mind, saer, I do believe you have your pass, and I have other customers. The vaults are just downstairs.

HeadClerk_73.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_73.text: If you mean to rob us, be about it - but leave my staff be.
HeadClerk_73.context: NodeContext: Tremulous, but firm - he and the other clerks are cowering at the back.

HeadClerk_89.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_89.text: I beg your pardon, but I'm still searching for that missing item. I... I do believe we may have been robbed.
HeadClerk_89.context: NodeContext: Spoken in undertones, not realising we're the robber

HeadClerk_102.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_102.text: Welcome to the Counting House. I'm Head Clerk Meadhoney - how may the Fellowship of Financiers serve you?
HeadClerk_102.context: NodeContext: Veneer of polite agreeableness, but should be showing slight hint of nerves. There's something unusual going on in the vaults today with your boss and a new customer, but you're trying to keep on keeping on.

HeadClerk_9.speaker: Minsc
HeadClerk_9.text: Do not fret, little banker. Minsc has no need of your services. Boo holds all our valuables in his little cheeks.

HeadClerk_53.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_53.context: NodeContext: Non-plussed, terrified, just wants us to leave

HeadClerk_205.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_205.text: Ah. S-saer Stone Lord. Returning to... make another withdrawal?
HeadClerk_205.context: NodeContext: Terrified - speaking to someone who just robbed your bank

HeadClerk_169.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_169.text: Do not fret, little banker. Minsc has no need of your services. Boo holds all our valuables in his little cheeks.

HeadClerk_187.speaker: Jaheira
HeadClerk_187.text: You seem a little nervous, Saer Meadhoney. Had some difficult customers today?
HeadClerk_187.context: NodeContext: Addressing a bank clerk with the theory that Minsc has passed by. Hesitating around calling him 'Stone Lord', but knowing it will probably help.

HeadClerk_8.speaker: Jaheira
HeadClerk_8.text: One in particular calling himself the Stone Lord, perhaps?

HeadClerk_118.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_118.text: All right. Fine. The Head Banker may have just taken a customer by that name down into the vaults.
HeadClerk_118.context: NodeContext: A pause, then he relents - he'd been nervous of what's happening in the bank and is eager to sort it out.

HeadClerk_40.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_40.text: Rather large. Rather heavily armed - which is against regulations - but I'm sure the Head Banker knows what he's doing.
HeadClerk_40.context: NodeContext: Warily describing Minsc being marched past security with the Head Banker - a heist in progress, he suspects. End of sentence is him putting a lid on his anxiety again - he's too proper to do anything about it.

HeadClerk_117.speaker: Jaheira
HeadClerk_117.text: I assure you. He does not. You're right to be nervous - but let us pass, and all will be well.

HeadClerk_196.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_196.text: Eh, well... who is this Stone Lord to you?
HeadClerk_196.context: NodeContext: Licking lips, wants our help in dealing with the Stone Lord but needs to know before letting us down into the vaults

HeadClerk_125.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_125.text: The absolute least of your problems if you don't shut up and let us pass.

HeadClerk_139.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_139.text: A friend. He might do something stupid down there, but we can help.

HeadClerk_136.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_136.text: A lord of Rashemen - and we are his servants. He's likely to pull his contract if we don't set up his banquet table soon.

HeadClerk_211.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_211.text: A lord in truth? Forgive me, he did not seem the type - or! I mean to say, he was most... down to earth.
HeadClerk_211.context: NodeContext: Genuinely surprised - Minsc didn't seem the type (ie, he looked like a barbarian)

HeadClerk_199.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_199.text: It's most unusual, but... that explains why the Head Banker has dispensed with normal procedure. I suppose I can let you pass, then.
HeadClerk_199.context: NodeContext: Nodding, talking himself around, eager to have a soltuion

HeadClerk_191.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_191.text: No. No. This will not do. This House has catered to its share of lords. Your friend is... something else.
HeadClerk_191.context: NodeContext: Was almost swayed, but snapping back to reality. He'll keep calm and carry on without our help, thanks very much.

HeadClerk_129.speaker: Narrator
HeadClerk_129.text: *A relaxed tone and easy smile - but the halfling's shifting gaze gives it away. Something has him rattled.*
HeadClerk_129.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of clerk's eyes not fully meeting ours.

HeadClerk_67.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_67.text: Will this one start breaking bones like the Stone Lord? Hins' horned feet, I should have been a baker.

HeadClerk_201.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_201.text: Remind me again where Head Banker Glitterbeard is?

HeadClerk_114.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_114.text: He's taken a new customer down to the vaults. A rather large and heavily armed fellow, but... I'm sure it's fine. We are just fine.
HeadClerk_114.context: NodeContext: Poorly masking his concern - 'it's fine' is just as much to convince himself as you

HeadClerk_69.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_69.text: What strangeness? Tell me what's going on - I can help.

HeadClerk_70.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_70.text: Your help is not needed. Your compliance is. So please - account business only.
HeadClerk_70.context: NodeContext: ruffled, put out by the player

HeadClerk_101.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_101.text: You seem agitated. Is everything all right?

HeadClerk_112.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_112.text: Oh, fine. Fine. A rather large and heavily armed fellow has taken the Head Banker Glitterbeard below.

HeadClerk_179.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_179.text: He's... an unusual sort of customer. But the Head Banker said he'd handle it, so it's fine. I'm sure we're just fine.

HeadClerk_90.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_90.text: Let me help. I'll go and check on your Head Banker.

HeadClerk_148.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_148.text: That would be most unusual. But then... so is our visitor.

HeadClerk_135.speaker: Jaheira
HeadClerk_135.text: That he is. But don't worry, we can handle him.

HeadClerk_76.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_76.text: Very well. Show the guards this temporary vault pass. And should my superior ask, keep my name out of it.

HeadClerk_103.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_103.text: Ah. I fear... well, I seem to have misplaced the pass. Perhaps we are over-subscribed. Either way - so sorry to have wasted your time.
HeadClerk_103.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

HeadClerk_94.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_94.text: The Head Banker of the Counting House deals with all manner of clientele, no matter how colourful. He does not need your help.

HeadClerk_121.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_121.text: As Head Clerk, I am happy to assist you in opening an account. Otherwise...?

HeadClerk_64.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_64.text: I suppose I'll find another way down, then.

HeadClerk_126.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_126.text: You are free to throw away your life in any way you choose.

HeadClerk_16.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_16.text: Splendid! New coin and customers always welcome.

HeadClerk_206.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_206.text: We need only settle the matter of Waukeen's Wage. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

HeadClerk_167.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_167.text: A minor fee for new accounts. So Our Lady of Trade might bless this business venture.

HeadClerk_51.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_51.text: Waukeen's coin, most gratefully received. And in return - a pass to the vaults, and your own personal key. Strongbox Five.

HeadClerk_58.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_58.text: As I mentioned, we have some... other clients carrying out a transaction below. I would ask for your discretion.

HeadClerk_120.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_120.text: Lastly, I would ask for your discretion today. We have some... other clients visiting below.

HeadClerk_91.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_91.text: You've only just joined us, so I'll clarify the service we offer. Security. And privacy.

HeadClerk_107.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_107.text: They mind their business, I'll mind mine.

HeadClerk_81.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_81.text: Ah. I fear... well, I seem to have misplaced the pass. Perhaps we are over-subscribed. So sorry - but please do take your coin back.
HeadClerk_81.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

HeadClerk_5.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_5.text: Ah. I fear... well, I seem to have misplaced the vault key. Perhaps it's already been allocated to someone else. So sorry - but please do take your coin back.
HeadClerk_5.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.Confused and absolutely mortified, but putting up a polite show

HeadClerk_165.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_165.context: NodeContext: Politely ending the conversation with us, the customer, to go back and look for the items he's missing (either a vault key or a bank pass he doesn't know we've stolen)

HeadClerk_37.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_37.text: Ah. I fear... well, I seem to have misplaced key and vault pass both. Perhaps it's already been allocated to someone else. So sorry - but please do take your coin back.

HeadClerk_142.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_142.text: I've recently come into a large estate. Could I sign it against that as a guarantee instead?

HeadClerk_203.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_203.text: Naturally. We serve the Gate's oldest families - not all have cash in hand. What kind of establishment would we be if we saw value in coin alone?

HeadClerk_68.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_68.text: Could you provide the address of your property?

HeadClerk_38.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_38.text: Oh, by the Coinmaiden! How, er, quaint. And the name of the manor?

HeadClerk_202.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_202.text: Bhaal. As in, the Lord of Murder.

HeadClerk_164.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_164.text: B-H-A-A-L. Er, it's an old family name.

HeadClerk_47.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_47.text: Silly me - of course! Let me check our records...

HeadClerk_30.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_30.text: I'm afraid your estate is not registered on the Sword Coast customs censuses - have you been paying your mansion taxes?

HeadClerk_177.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_177.text: Or perhaps it isn't valued highly enough to be above the threshold.

HeadClerk_79.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_79.text: It is an illustrious household. We employ paid help!

HeadClerk_13.speaker: Narrator
HeadClerk_13.text: *You wonder how many years ago it was you last gave Sceleritas so much as a table scrap of your dinner, let alone any paycoin.*

HeadClerk_145.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_145.text: There's a refugee labour crisis on. Any country merchant with half a copper could hire a fleet of butlers.

HeadClerk_11.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_11.text: The indignity! I'm heir to one of the oldest families in this city!

HeadClerk_23.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_23.text: Then why not bring the gold for the account? Father not given out your allowance yet?

HeadClerk_131.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_131.text: Kindly return with coin in hand. I'm sure that is well within the talents of one of your means.

HeadClerk_141.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_141.text: Fool! I will soon hold the treasures of the world over, as all tremble in stricken awe.

HeadClerk_104.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_104.text: Do come back when you do!

HeadClerk_63.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_63.text: Did I say 'Bhaal'? I meant the 'Bowel' Temple.

HeadClerk_105.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_105.text: Ah, I'm afraid we already have an entry by that name. A rather popular bathhouse in the sewers.

HeadClerk_147.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_147.text: It's not really a manor, it's more of a lair.

HeadClerk_133.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_133.text: Unfortunately, we do not have a repayment plan available for 'lairs'.

HeadClerk_150.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_150.text: We do tunnel insurance for mining business, and home vault maintenance. Those are the sole subterranean ventures the House will consider.

HeadClerk_56.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_56.text: I can hardly enact a loan on your house if you won't tell me where it is.

HeadClerk_195.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_195.text: Do the Coinmaiden's followers not provide a discount for faithful folk?

HeadClerk_173.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_173.text: Oh, you're a person of the cloth? I'm sorry, of course we can provide a discount. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

HeadClerk_82.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_82.text: I don't have that kind of money.

HeadClerk_29.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_29.text: I want you to store my coin, not steal it.

HeadClerk_181.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_181.text: You wish to patronise the Sword Coast's most eminent bank.

HeadClerk_12.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_12.text: Might I suggest scratching some coppers together first?

HeadClerk_144.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_144.text: There is no door I cannot unlock - no room I cannot enter. I will find another way down.

HeadClerk_193.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_193.text: I'm something of a security expert. That sounds like a breach - why don't I go check?

HeadClerk_44.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_44.text: I wield magic with the ease of breathing - perhaps I could help? Maybe check on your Head Banker?

HeadClerk_158.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_158.text: I'm rather large and heavily armed myself. Why not let me check on your Head Banker, just to be safe?

HeadClerk_35.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_35.text: I can check on your banker. Your vaults are safe from me - I have no interest in gold.

HeadClerk_138.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_138.text: I'm rather heavily armed myself. I'll be heading down below, too.

HeadClerk_6.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_6.text: I'm armed and far more dangerous - so I'll see myself downstairs.

HeadClerk_28.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_28.text: Ah, a threat? Our other visitor simply skipped straight to violence.

HeadClerk_83.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_83.text: No need, I am convinced! Show the guards this temporary vault pass. And should my superior ask, keep my name out of it.

HeadClerk_153.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_153.text: Ah. I fear... well, I seem to have misplaced the pass. Perhaps we are over-subscribed. So sorry - but I won't be able to help you today.
HeadClerk_153.context: NodeContext: Patting himself down but can't find the item he wanted to give us.A little worried as we were threatening him, but putting up a polite show -

HeadClerk_110.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_110.text: Do you know, I've quite heard my fill of threats today. They are weak currency, quite devalued.

HeadClerk_149.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_149.text: And everything will stay fine. So long as you let me down into your vault.

HeadClerk_14.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_14.text: Nothing is fine. This place is about to suffer a terrible curse - unless you let me down into the vault.

HeadClerk_77.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_77.text: Tell me more about this large fellow.

HeadClerk_172.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_172.text: Honestly, that about describes him. Over a certain size, well... you all begin to look the same. My eyesight, you see.

HeadClerk_96.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_96.text: The Head Banker did seem to expect him - but he seemed frightened, too.

HeadClerk_1.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_1.text: It sounds like a robbery to me.

HeadClerk_61.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_61.text: Our books stretch back to near the city's founding. No robbery has ever been recorded.

HeadClerk_15.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_15.text: They also make no mention of Glitterbeard's stranger guests, but... I'm sure that's a separate matter entirely.

HeadClerk_71.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_71.text: I want to open an account.

HeadClerk_204.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_204.text: ...Of course! Forgive me, you have your own business to attend to, I'm sure.

HeadClerk_176.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_176.text: Just fine. Eager to serve, any way I may.

HeadClerk_190.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_190.text: You seem ill at ease. I am a cleric, and well used to hearing strangers' woes. Are you well?

HeadClerk_189.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_189.text: You smile but your body language says otherwise. Is everything all right?

HeadClerk_124.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_124.text: You think too much! SHOUT YOUR WORRIES OUT. GO ON.

HeadClerk_174.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_174.text: I will not shout, but if it will appease you - a rather large and heavily armed fellow has taken Head Banker Glitterbeard below.

HeadClerk_2.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_2.text: I beg your pardon - this is the house of the Lady of Trade, not a common tavern. So please - account business only.
HeadClerk_2.context: NodeContext: ruffled, put out by the player

HeadClerk_33.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_33.text: I'm writing a ballad - 'The Bothered Banker'. Hearing what's on your mind would really help.

HeadClerk_78.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_78.text: I can't imagine who would want to hear such a song, but... as you will. A rather large and heavily armed fellow has accompanied Head Banker Glitterbeard down to the vault.
HeadClerk_78.context: NodeContext: Perplexed, but relenting - he's a little nervous about the situation so willing to confide.

HeadClerk_162.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_162.text: You're writing a what? A ballad?

HeadClerk_43.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_43.text: Who is this Stone Lord that has you worried?

HeadClerk_127.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_127.text: All right, fine! A rather large and heavily armed fellow has taken Head Banker Glitterbeard below. He used that name.
HeadClerk_127.context: NodeContext: Nervous, relenting to tell us some information we've been pressing for

HeadClerk_50.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_50.text: I'm not a customer. I'm here because Nine-Fingers is planning something in your vault.

HeadClerk_198.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_198.text: A name of that repute has nothing to do with an honest banking house, I assure you.

HeadClerk_10.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_10.text: We've had quite enough strangeness for one day, my thanks. By which I only mean -

HeadClerk_194.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_194.text: If you have no business here... well. You have no business here.

HeadClerk_159.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_159.text: I'm here on behalf of our mutual employer - Nine-Fingers Keene?

HeadClerk_52.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_52.text: Head Banker Glitterbeard - you know he's involved with the Guild, yes?

HeadClerk_55.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_55.text: I have proudly served this institution for many, many years. I open, I close, and I am well-paid for it.

HeadClerk_31.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_31.text: But there are still... certain matters... that I am not paid to handle. That is all I will say on the matter.

HeadClerk_59.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_59.text: I need access to your vaults.

HeadClerk_209.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_209.text: Ah! Then you'll need a vault pass.

HeadClerk_132.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_132.text: I would like to open an account.

HeadClerk_156.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_156.text: If you wish to open an account, you are more than welcome. Otherwise, I do have work to do.

HeadClerk_160.speaker: Player
HeadClerk_160.text: I would like to open an account.

HeadClerk_171.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
HeadClerk_171.text: The Stone Lord - you are with him...? If you could keep him from cracking any more of my guard's skulls, I would be most obliged.
HeadClerk_171.context: NodeContext: Frightened but polite, doesn't want to set us off again

HeadBankerOfficeGuard_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Faona
HeadBankerOfficeGuard_0.text: Enough messing, now - back with the other customers.

HeadBankerOfficeGuard_1.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Faona
HeadBankerOfficeGuard_1.text: Head Banker Glitterbeard! You look a little different today. Or - you're not him, which means this door isn't for you. Very sorry.

AD_VaultWarningGuard_Alarm_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Dadger
AD_VaultWarningGuard_Alarm_0.context: NodeContext: Crying out after spotting player trespassing

LobbyWarningGuard_1.speaker: Cashguard Basher Forstum
LobbyWarningGuard_1.text: Best behaviour down in the vaults - there's worse than us guarding the place.

LobbyWarningGuard_2.speaker: Cashguard Basher Forstum
LobbyWarningGuard_2.text: Captain needs to see your pass!

AD_Clerks_ChitChat_5.speaker: Clerk Zollerix
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_5.text: Are you thinking what I'm thinking?

AD_Clerks_ChitChat_7.speaker: Clerk Chervis
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_7.text: I am, if you're looking where I'm looking.
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_7.context: NodeContext: pure love in her voice for her daughter

AD_Clerks_ChitChat_8.speaker: Clerk Zollerix
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_8.text: Do you have any blank vouching documents?

AD_Clerks_ChitChat_4.speaker: Clerk Chervis
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_4.text: No - but I've got a little brandy in hip flask. Want a nip?
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_4.context: NodeContext: considering tone, enjoying chatting to her duaghter

AD_Clerks_ChitChat_1.speaker: Clerk Zollerix
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_1.text: During work hours? Are you crazy?

AD_Clerks_ChitChat_6.speaker: Clerk Chervis
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_6.text: That's what they tell me. But we'll save it for later.

AD_Clerks_ChitChat_9.speaker: Clerk Zollerix
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_9.text: So, I told him 'I'm not that kind of drow.'

AD_Clerks_ChitChat_0.speaker: Clerk Chervis
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_0.text: You didn't! And what did he say?
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_0.context: NodeContext: speaking to vanra (non hag state). Vanra is being cheeky, lora is cheeky in return

AD_Clerks_ChitChat_3.speaker: Clerk Zollerix
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_3.text: He said, and I'm not kidding, 'What's stopping you?'
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_3.context: NodeContext: thinks she's being very clever by trying to 'trick' her mother into cake for dinner

AD_Clerks_ChitChat_2.speaker: Clerk Chervis
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_2.text: Waukeen's scales! I'd have slapped him.
AD_Clerks_ChitChat_2.context: NodeContext: playing along with vanra, pretending she's considering it

Guard_05_0.speaker: Cashguard Yonni
Guard_05_0.text: First some nutter cult marching on us, now some nutter killer running around. I'd be grabbing my coin and clearing out, too.

Guard_05_1.speaker: Cashguard Yonni
Guard_05_1.text: Think this armour's real gold? Some Guildie offered me coin for it.

Clerk_002_0.speaker: Clerk Zollerix
Clerk_002_0.text: Can't talk. Last time I missed quota, Head Banker Glitterbeard locked me in a safety deposit box.

Clerk_002_1.speaker: Clerk Zollerix
Clerk_002_1.context: NodeContext: Panicked shout - cowering while bank alarm goes off

Clerk_002_2.speaker: Clerk Zollerix
Clerk_002_2.text: It's the bloody vault staff slowing us. Bet you they're napping down there.

SwD_Cultist_01_19.speaker: Narrator
SwD_Cultist_01_19.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

SwD_Cultist_01_16.speaker: Player
SwD_Cultist_01_16.text: Why do you follow the Stone Lord?

SwD_Cultist_01_25.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Feona
SwD_Cultist_01_25.text: Bringer of death... know... to our master...

SwD_Cultist_01_11.speaker: Player
SwD_Cultist_01_11.text: Where can I find the Stone Lord?

SwD_Cultist_01_29.speaker: Player
SwD_Cultist_01_29.text: Who was that wearing Jaheira's face?

SwD_Cultist_01_23.speaker: Player
SwD_Cultist_01_23.text: Who was that, wearing my face?

SwD_Cultist_01_0.speaker: Player
SwD_Cultist_01_0.text: What did the cult want in the vaults?

SwD_Cultist_01_6.speaker: Player
SwD_Cultist_01_6.text: What does the cult want with Minsc?

SwD_Cultist_01_4.speaker: Death's Head of Bhaal Feona
SwD_Cultist_01_4.text: Minsc... is dead... Stone Lord... lives...

SwD_Cultist_01_26.speaker: Narrator
SwD_Cultist_01_26.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

SwD_Cultist_01_28.speaker: Narrator
SwD_Cultist_01_28.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

AD_Sign_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Sign_0.text: *Customers are asked to follow all instructions promptly, and without resistance.*

AD_Sign_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_Sign_1.text: *Customers are reminded that the lower vaults are the sole jurisdiction of the Counting House guards above all other authorities, earthly or divine.*

AD_Sign_2.speaker: Narrator
AD_Sign_2.text: *A list of politely-phrased advisories from the Fellowship of Financiers.*

Guard_07_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Heen
Guard_07_0.text: Don't linger too long under the chandeliers. If another tremor hits... well, that'd make a pretty mess.

Guard_07_1.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Heen
Guard_07_1.text: My mum says those tremors are from drow digging up through the Underdark. My mum... doesn't get out much.

AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_5.speaker: Cashguard Yonni
AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_5.text: You know what we ought to do? We ought to heist this joint.

AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_7.speaker: Cashguard Dugg
AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_7.text: Oh, I love your sense of humour, Yonni.

AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_8.speaker: Cashguard Yonni
AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_8.text: Seen that new drow cashier? She's full of herself.

AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_4.speaker: Cashguard Dugg
AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_4.text: I think she's got a reason to feel that way.

AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_1.speaker: Cashguard Yonni
AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_1.text: Oh? Go for those Menzo gals, do you?

AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_6.speaker: Cashguard Dugg
AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_6.text: I might, except Gladiss would kill me.

AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_9.speaker: Cashguard Yonni
AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_9.text: Docks Sentry is the worst damn job at the House.

AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_3.speaker: Cashguard Yonni
AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_3.text: It's boring, plus it's boring, and also it's boring.

AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_2.speaker: Cashguard Dugg
AD_DocksDoorGuards_Convo_2.text: I like it, though. Nice view. Restful.

AD_VaultButtonGuard_Idle_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Smathers
AD_VaultButtonGuard_Idle_0.text: Let me leave an example of how it's done: 'Two visitors to vault. Escorted by Head Banker himself. Large human, bald. Middling half-elf, elderly.'
AD_VaultButtonGuard_Idle_0.context: NodeContext: Irriitated, writing own log entry with detail to show it's done. (They're referring to Minsc and the doppelganger posing as Jaheira having passed just through.)

AD_VaultButtonGuard_Idle_2.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Smathers
AD_VaultButtonGuard_Idle_2.context: NodeContext: Second-guessing themselves on 'elderly' at the end.

AD_VaultButtonGuard_Idle_1.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Smathers
AD_VaultButtonGuard_Idle_1.text: 'Glitterbeard took delivery. Strange chest.' Full of what, you fool? It's not the bloody wood and brass we guard, is it?
AD_VaultButtonGuard_Idle_1.context: NodeContext: Reading over a logbook entry from the last guard on shift, railing at the incomplete detail.

AD_VaultButtonGuard_Idle_3.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Smathers
AD_VaultButtonGuard_Idle_3.text: What, by Ilmater's holy hands, is this? Did the last guard write the log with his bloody toes?
AD_VaultButtonGuard_Idle_3.context: NodeContext: 'What. The Fuck. Is this shit?'

Civilian_02_0.speaker: Mevelenora
Civilian_02_0.text: If you're wise, you'll withdraw everything and clear out before this army arrives. I'm not taking any chances.

Civilian_02_1.speaker: Mevelenora
Civilian_02_1.text: I've got a sister in Neverwinter. She'll welcome the help 'round the house - and the coin too, no doubt.

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_7.speaker: Brid Hunley
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_7.text: You're having lunch with me, you know.

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_3.speaker: Cashier Stivvo
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_3.text: Well, I suppose. If I must.

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_8.speaker: Brid Hunley
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_8.text: My name's Hunley, but you can call me Brid.

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_16.speaker: Cashier Stivvo
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_16.text: Can I? Maybe I will. Or maybe I won't.

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_12.speaker: Brid Hunley
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_12.text: So you have to count all the money returned from the Stone Lord?

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_14.speaker: Cashier Stivvo
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_14.text: Sure do. That's life as a cashier.

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_1.speaker: Brid Hunley
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_1.text: How long will it take? When's your shift over?

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_18.speaker: Cashier Stivvo
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_18.text: Why do you...? Oh. We'll talk later, handsome.

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_9.speaker: Brid Hunley
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_9.text: Having to wait on customers all day.

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_11.speaker: Cashier Stivvo
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_11.text: Oh, well, you know. Some customers aren't so bad.

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_17.speaker: Brid Hunley
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_17.text: Will your shift be over soon?

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_2.speaker: Brid Hunley
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_2.text: Someone who wants to take you for a drink.

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_10.speaker: Cashier Stivvo
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_10.text: Now, I wonder who that could be?

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_19.speaker: Brid Hunley
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_19.text: How did you end up as a counting house cashier?

AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_5.speaker: Brid Hunley
AD_Clerk_Civilian_Convo_5.text: You have the natural elegance of a dancer.

AD_Civilian_03_Annoyed_0.speaker: Legarioll
AD_Civilian_03_Annoyed_0.text: Three more minutes and I'm out of here! All right, maybe five.

AD_Civilian_03_Annoyed_1.speaker: Legarioll
AD_Civilian_03_Annoyed_1.text: Humans and their currency! Why can't we just barter on trust?

AD_Civilian_03_Annoyed_2.speaker: Legarioll
AD_Civilian_03_Annoyed_2.text: I wouldn't have to come down here if they hadn't shut the Heapside branch.

Civilian_05_0.speaker: Brialavant
Civilian_05_0.text: If you cannot get the coin you need here, try for a room at the Elfsong. Alan has plenty of space in his upper floors.

Civilian_05_1.speaker: Brialavant
Civilian_05_1.text: If Alan is out of rooms... well, the Church of Last Hope has shut down ahead of the army's arrival. A bad joke, that.

AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultLockpickAttempt.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultLockpickAttempt.text: Are you trying to get me fired? Leave the vaults alone! Please?

AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultLockpickAttempt.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultLockpickAttempt.text: Because it's you, I'm going to let you off with a warning.

AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultLockpickAttempt.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
AD_HeadBanker_SawVipVaultLockpickAttempt.text: Do you see what I'm doing? I'm looking the other way here.

HeadClerkOfficeGuard_0.speaker: Cashguard Basher Karol
HeadClerkOfficeGuard_0.text: Enough messing, now - back with the other customers.

HeadClerkOfficeGuard_1.speaker: Cashguard Basher Karol
HeadClerkOfficeGuard_1.text: Don't you have anything better to do?

Guard_09_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Triava
Guard_09_0.text: Keep to the lobby please, saer - no going below without a vault pass.

PAD_IncorrectPinCodeEntered_0.speaker: Player
PAD_IncorrectPinCodeEntered_0.text: Didn't work. Need to try a different sequence.

AD_Civilian_02_Annoyed_0.speaker: Mevelenora
AD_Civilian_02_Annoyed_0.text: I would smite them all! ...If I didn't need this letter of credit cashed.

AD_Civilian_02_Annoyed_1.speaker: Mevelenora
AD_Civilian_02_Annoyed_1.text: In Menzoberranzan, keeping me waiting like this would be a capital offence.

AD_Civilian_02_Annoyed_2.speaker: Mevelenora
AD_Civilian_02_Annoyed_2.text: By the Weaver! I do not feel like a valued client.

Civilian_04_0.speaker: Gilla Merrun
Civilian_04_0.text: If you're one of Barek's friends sent to talk me down, tell him I've made up my mind! I'm buying that stake in the circus and running away!

Civilian_04_1.speaker: Gilla Merrun
Civilian_04_1.text: You don't understand. Barek doesn't understand. The way Ringmaster Lucretious looked at me...

AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_5.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Dadger
AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_5.text: Head Banker Glitterbeard almost got my name right today.

AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_8.speaker: Cashguard Basher Nickelow
AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_8.text: Never mind Glitterbeard. It's Meadhoney's good books you want to be in.
AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_8.context: NodeContext: pure love in her voice for her daughter

AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_7.speaker: Cashguard Basher Nickelow
AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_7.text: Glitterbeard might shake hands and smile, but it's Meadhoney who can assign you to the graveyard shift.

AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_9.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Dadger
AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_9.text: You ever seen anyone actually raid this place?

AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_4.speaker: Cashguard Basher Nickelow
AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_4.context: NodeContext: considering tone, enjoying chatting to her duaghter

AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_6.speaker: Cashguard Basher Nickelow
AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_6.text: If it has, I doubt the guards get to stick around to tell about it.

AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_10.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Dadger
AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_10.text: We'll be pulling a late one tonight.

AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_3.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Dadger
AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_3.text: Half that crowd up there aren't getting their coin. Some will go quietly out the front door...
AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_3.context: NodeContext: A veteran telling a young guard how they're going to deal with rowdy customers

AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_2.speaker: Cashguard Basher Nickelow
AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_2.text: And some will go out with a splash by the dock door. Right.
AD_PreVaultCheckpointGuards_Convo_2.context: NodeContext: getting the hint, finishing with a chuckle.

AD_Guard_12_Patrol_0.speaker: Cashguard Helenia
AD_Guard_12_Patrol_0.text: I've got this. I've got this. Shift ends soon.

AD_Guard_12_Patrol_1.speaker: Cashguard Helenia
AD_Guard_12_Patrol_1.text: That was a late night last night, I tell you what. Whew!

AD_Guard_12_Patrol_2.speaker: Cashguard Helenia
AD_Guard_12_Patrol_2.text: Not sleepy. A-LERT and A-WARE, that's me.

AD_Guard_07_Alarm_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Heen
AD_Guard_07_Alarm_0.text: Alert! Alert! We got a situation here!

AD_PrivateGuard_01_Idle_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Morra
AD_PrivateGuard_01_Idle_0.text: Mum used to tell me about Minsc of Rashemen. Now I've got a story for her.

AD_PrivateGuard_01_Idle_1.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Morra
AD_PrivateGuard_01_Idle_1.text: That old elf took two guards by herself. And she wasn't even scratched.

AD_PrivateGuard_01_Idle_2.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Morra
AD_PrivateGuard_01_Idle_2.text: Ugh. I'll be picking mimic teeth out of my clothes for a tenday.

AD_PrivateGuard_01_TadpoledBetrayal_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Morra
AD_PrivateGuard_01_TadpoledBetrayal_0.text: Sorry, Glitterbeard - but the Absolute has judged you unworthy.

Guard_06_0.speaker: Cashguard Basher Brammels
Guard_06_0.text: If you've had a smooth experience here today, saer - maybe pass it on upstairs? Bit worried they'll replace us with the Steel Watch, heh.
Guard_06_0.context: NodeContext: Politely soliciting, into nervous chuckle at the end

Guard_06_1.speaker: Cashguard Basher Brammels
Guard_06_1.text: They wouldn't replace us with the Steel Watch. The gold plating alone would beggar even this place.
Guard_06_1.context: NodeContext: False confidence, trying to convince himself

AD_Guard_01_Idle_0.speaker: Cashguard Basher Mofty
AD_Guard_01_Idle_0.text: What about bugbears? I might be as strong as a bugbear.

AD_Guard_01_Idle_1.speaker: Cashguard Basher Mofty
AD_Guard_01_Idle_1.text: Ogres don't come into banks, though, so I don't need to worry.

AD_Guard_01_Idle_2.speaker: Cashguard Basher Mofty
AD_Guard_01_Idle_2.text: I'm really strong, but I bet an ogre is stronger.

AD_Guard_05_Alarm_0.speaker: Cashguard Yonni
AD_Guard_05_Alarm_0.text: Trespass in progress! Sound the alarm!

AD_Civilian_05_Annoyed_0.speaker: Brialavant
AD_Civilian_05_Annoyed_0.text: I see - she's too important to wait in line! Figures.

AD_Civilian_05_Annoyed_1.speaker: Brialavant
AD_Civilian_05_Annoyed_1.text: I wonder when she'll demand to speak to the manager.

AD_Civilian_05_Annoyed_2.speaker: Brialavant
AD_Civilian_05_Annoyed_2.text: By the roots! This gnome lady ahead of me is like to blow her top.

AD_PrivateGuard_03_TadpoledBetrayal_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Loretta
AD_PrivateGuard_03_TadpoledBetrayal_0.context: NodeContext: A betrayal shouted in battle

AD_PrivateGuard_03_TadpoledBetrayal_1.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
AD_PrivateGuard_03_TadpoledBetrayal_1.context: NodeContext: annoyed at betrayal by his underling

Guard_13_1.speaker: Cashguard Basher Humgoole
Guard_13_1.text: Hm? It's probably Meadhoney you want, begging pardon.

PAD_PinCodeAlternativeSolution_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PinCodeAlternativeSolution_0.text: Seems we don't need a combination for the door after all.

Clerk_000_0.speaker: Cashier Stivvo
Clerk_000_0.text: Sorry, saer, but these people won't see to themselves.

Clerk_000_1.speaker: Cashier Stivvo
Clerk_000_1.text: I saw nothing! Hells, I'd rob this place too!
Clerk_000_1.context: NodeContext: Frantic, panicked friendliness - cowering as bank alarm goes off, just wants us gone

Clerk_000_2.speaker: Cashier Stivvo
Clerk_000_2.text: If it's a vault pass you need, speak to Head Clerk Meadhoney, please. Saer.

Guard_08_0.speaker: Cashguard Galleass
Guard_08_0.text: Only the Head Banker can accompany you down to the vaults, I'm afraid. I'm sure he'll be back shortly.

Guard_08_1.speaker: Cashguard Galleass
Guard_08_1.text: May Waukeen shift the scales in your favour.

Heist_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player enters a wide chamber in utter disarray, as if recently ransacked. Unaware of the party, several fearful clerks are speaking in hushed tones around a large chest.

Heist_64.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Loretta
Heist_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up of chest - revealing mimic's distinctive eyes and teeth.

Heist_27.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
Heist_27.text: Hush your fussing. Nine-Fingers had this one made especially - that little mouthful will barely slow it down.
Heist_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unconcerned, Rakath takes out a smoking pipe, and sprinkles some tobacco in.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe

Heist_4.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Loretta
Heist_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rathgard pauses, not remembering where he placed his matches.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe

Heist_14.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
Heist_14.text: Stories. Tall tales and big names, lad - don't let them fool you.
Heist_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rakath pats around his pockets looking for his matches.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe

Heist_31.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
Heist_31.text: Elminster the archmage. Drizzt the drow exile. Heroes have power, aye - but not half so much as we do.
Heist_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Slow zoom in on mimic as its shaking picks up pace while Rakath speaks.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe. (Elminster = el-MIN-ster; Drizzt = DRIZT)

Heist_59.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
Heist_59.text: A little coin into the right purse. A soft word in the right ear. It's not glory that spins these planes, lad - it's gold.
Heist_59.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The mimic practically BOUNCES - then stills, and lets out a short, sharp BURP.

Rakath, satified, snaps his fingers, casting the Produce Flame cantrip, and a candle flame appears over his fingers.

He lights the pipe as he delivers his line.NodeContext: JLatino: Get alts with and without the pipe in mouth, deliver the version with a pipe

Heist_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc's fat fist bursts from inside the mimic, teeth fly. Rakath squawks in alarm.

Heist_73.speaker: Rakath Glitterbeard
Heist_73.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Reaction shot on Rakath as he takes a step back to avoid the pool of blood flowing from the mimic toward his feet.

The pipe drops from his mouth.NodeContext: Moradin = MO-ra-din. Retake of line needed - breathless and fearful. You thought for sure the man you trapped was dead and done with, but he just tored his way free with his bare hands

Heist_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: The mimic falls forward, the lid straining to stay shut, Minsc emerges peeling back the rows of teeth. Standing to his full height, the beloved ranger snaps the jaws of the mimic, its tongue flapping. The creature goes limp and Minsc allows it to thump to the ground.

Heist_39.speaker: Minsc
Heist_39.text: There is no gold in here.
Heist_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking down at mimic, then up at Rakath.NodeContext: TarikS: starting position 45 degree left, hands up stretching, turns right to look down at mimic then face forward

Heist_57.speaker: Minsc
Heist_57.text: If there is one thing Minsc hates more than beasts with bad breath -
Heist_57.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Minsc leans in close to Rakath's face. He stops his line, distracted.

The mimic's tongue starts moving at Minsc's feet, the monster is regaining conciousness.

Heist_50.speaker: Minsc
Heist_50.text: - it is those who are tricksome with the truth.
Heist_50.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Minsc gathers the tongue up in a bear-hug and then turns, hammer-throwing the mimic across the room. 

He turns back to Rakath, breathing hard.NodeContext: Effort for throwing, then line

Heist_0.speaker: Minsc
Heist_0.text: And turnips. But you are no turnip. Let that be of comfort, in your final moments.
Heist_0.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Briefly considering, then raising his sword to strike.NodeContext: <TarikS> holding sword with two hands.
Briefly considering, then raising his sword to strike. Brief break in intensity on the this whole line - delivered in almost a friendly fashion, as he believes it actually SHOULD be of comfort.

Heist_63.speaker: Jaheira
Heist_63.text: Meet Minsc. He still seems very much himself to me.
Heist_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Preparing to step out an intervene.

Heist_53.speaker: Karlach
Heist_53.text: Oh my gods. I'm gonna faint!
Heist_53.context: NodeContext: Seeing Minsc for the first time (she's a fangirl).

Heist_35.speaker: Lae'zel
Heist_35.text: Minsc?! The same Minsc Jaheira's been looking for?

Heist_42.speaker: Shadowheart
Heist_42.text: Minsc? The very man Jaheira is after.

Heist_65.speaker: Astarion
Heist_65.text: That's the Minsc Jaheira's been searching for? Good gods...

Heist_36.speaker: Wyll
Heist_36.text: Minsc? Then the great hero is here!

Heist_54.speaker: Gale
Heist_54.text: Minsc - the very same Jaheira seeks.

Heist_32.speaker: Karlach
Heist_32.text: Is that... the Beloved Ranger? Jaheira is gonna burst! I'm gonna burst. Oh my gods - Minsc!
Heist_32.context: NodeContext: Excited, but to the player rather tahn shouted out.

Heist_67.speaker: Player
Heist_67.text: Wait, Jaheira. He doesn't seem in any state to listen.

Heist_51.speaker: Jaheira
Heist_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Makes as if to step out, but stops short at next voice.

Heist_52.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_JaheiraClone_JaheiraVoice
Heist_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc was hefting his sword to attack, but stalls at a voice from the podium.

Heist_18.speaker: Jaheira
Heist_18.context: NodeContext: Reacting with utter shock at what she sees

Heist_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: From the vaults at the back of the room, an elf step steps into view. Jaheira, identical down to the last grey hair. She is spattered with blood.

Heist_70.speaker: Jaheira
Heist_70.text: Stone Lord? Better to call yourself Stone-Head.

Heist_37.speaker: Minsc
Heist_37.text: Your false face does not fool my eyes. I will cut until you look like the monster you truly are.
Heist_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking to the fake-Jaheira, then back at the real Jaheira, furious.

Heist_1.speaker: Jaheira
Heist_1.text: ...Somehow, you are making even less sense than usual.

Heist_66.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_JaheiraClone_JaheiraVoice
Heist_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc was hefting his sword to strike, but stalls at a voice from the podium.

Heist_15.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_JaheiraClone_JaheiraVoice
Heist_15.text: The Stone Lord sees through your lies, shapeshifter. Count yourself lucky he cannot stay.

Heist_6.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_JaheiraClone_JaheiraVoice
Heist_6.text: Nine-Fingers set a poor trap, little banker. Let the Absolute's faithful show you how it is done.
Heist_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raising voice to address Rakath / bankers. [TBD: Some cine-friendly gesture here to imply she's just killed a bunch of people. Holding up bloodied knife?]NodeContext: <TarikS> holding Knife with the right hand

Heist_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: At her gesture, portions of the floor / wall shimmer with VFX. Cultists step through as if passing through water - using Meld With Stone to launch their own ambush.

Heist_10.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_JaheiraClone_JaheiraVoice
Heist_10.text: Now come, Stone Lord. We have the gold - and the Absolute has need of it elsewhere.

Heist_21.speaker: Minsc
Heist_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Beat as Minsc fights his rage - then relents and turns to Jaheira's doppel. He trots to Jaheira's side and the portal winks shut behind them, leaving us alone with cultists and clerks.

Heist_5.speaker: Jaheira
Heist_5.text: Stlarning shapechangers. Enough! Let us deal with these cultists - then find out where they are nesting.
Heist_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Furious, begins to curse but reins herself in and refocuses.NodeContext: Stlarning = stuh-LARN-ing (a polite equivalent of "f*cking")

Heist_9.speaker: Lae'zel
Heist_9.text: Stealing your ally is one thing. Stealing your face? An ignoble act by any estimation.

Heist_56.speaker: Shadowheart
Heist_56.text: First they take her friend, then they steal her face. Some people just don't understand boundaries...

Heist_74.speaker: Astarion
Heist_74.text: First they take Jaheira's friend and then they take her face? Oh she's going to hate that.

Heist_44.speaker: Wyll
Heist_44.text: First, they took Minsc. Now, they take Jaheira's face. Does their malice have no limit?

Heist_29.speaker: Gale
Heist_29.text: Stealing someone's friend and their face? Boundaries clearly mean little to this lot.

Heist_40.speaker: Karlach
Heist_40.text: They stole her friend and her face. Damn, that's low.

Heist_24.speaker: Halsin
Heist_24.text: They have taken both Jaheira's friend and her face. Their gall knows no bounds.

Heist_71.speaker: Minsc
Heist_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc turns to see player/Jaheira step into view.

Heist_38.speaker: Minsc
Heist_38.text: The Absolute has shown me your face, villain. I will beat it into a more pleasing shape.
Heist_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Getting ready to attackNodeContext: <TarikS> Getting ready to attack with a two handed sword

Heist_16.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_JaheiraClone_JaheiraVoice
Heist_16.text: Enough play, Stone Lord. The Absolute has other plans for this one.
Heist_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc was hefting his sword to strike, but stalls at a voice from the podium.

AD_Civilian_01_Impatient_0.speaker: Skonal Dehann
AD_Civilian_01_Impatient_0.text: And some people just don't give a flying flumph.

AD_Civilian_01_Impatient_1.speaker: Skonal Dehann
AD_Civilian_01_Impatient_1.text: I said, some people have all day to spend talking to bank clerks!

AD_Civilian_01_Impatient_2.speaker: Skonal Dehann
AD_Civilian_01_Impatient_2.text: Some people have all day to spend talking to bank clerks.

AD_Guard_08_Patrol_0.speaker: Cashguard Galleass
AD_Guard_08_Patrol_0.text: I should just wait out front in the morning and catch Rakath when he comes in to work. Yeah!

AD_Guard_08_Patrol_1.speaker: Cashguard Galleass
AD_Guard_08_Patrol_1.text: I wonder if anyone will listen to a mere cashguard, though?

AD_Guard_08_Patrol_2.speaker: Cashguard Galleass
AD_Guard_08_Patrol_2.text: I think I know how to make the House even more secure.

Guard_12_0.speaker: Cashguard Helenia
Guard_12_0.text: No disrespect, but I'd be joining the queue. Some business down in the vaults is slowing us down.

Guard_12_1.speaker: Cashguard Helenia
Guard_12_1.text: The clerks will help you as soon as they can.

AD_Guard_06_Patrol_0.speaker: Cashguard Basher Brammels
AD_Guard_06_Patrol_0.text: Haven't seen Glitterbeard in a while. No complaints.
AD_Guard_06_Patrol_0.context: NodeContext: Glitterbeard is a superior you're glad not to have seen for a while - he's annoying

AD_Guard_06_Patrol_2.speaker: Cashguard Basher Brammels
AD_Guard_06_Patrol_2.text: Good and quiet. Just how it should be.

AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_5.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Jacko
AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_5.text: What are you thinking about for lunch?

AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_8.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Jacko
AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_8.text: Look at all these fools. What are they pulling their money for?

AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_4.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Erus
AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_4.text: Killer. Cult. Army. Take your pick.

AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_9.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Jacko
AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_9.text: You hear that? S'like... a swishing.

AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Erus
AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_0.context: NodeContext: speaking to vanra (non hag state). Vanra is being cheeky, lora is cheeky in return

AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_1.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Jacko
AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_1.text: It's like... a whining, or something?

AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_6.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Erus
AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_6.text: Maybe if you're quiet I'll hear it.
AD_MainEntranceGuards_Convo_6.context: NodeContext: Finally getting irritated at his coworker

Guard_10_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Thamberg
Guard_10_0.text: Please be mindful that we're a little short-staffed at the moment. This Absolute army has some people packing up.

Guard_04_0.speaker: Cashguard Dugg
Guard_04_0.text: Needn't queue if you're a member, saer. Just go straight to Meadhoney with your vault pass.

AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_6.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Faona
AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_6.text: What's your Guild name? Y'know, like Nine-Fingers, Ribbons, Fruward the Nail...
AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_6.context: NodeContext: excited, hushed, speaking to a member of a criminal organisation he dislikes

AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_5.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Faona
AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_5.context: NodeContext: nervous exhalation - just been threatened.

AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_9.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Faona
AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_9.context: NodeContext: Hushed, just figuring it out

AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_1.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Faona
AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_1.text: You're always guarding Glitterbeard's door, no matter who's on with you. You're definitely Guild - not that you'd tell me.

AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_7.speaker: Cashguard Basher Karol
AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_7.text: No. I'd probably just break your jaw for asking.

AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Faona
AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_0.text: I'm not. I'm just keeping on eye on Glitterbeard's office.

AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_2.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Faona
AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_2.text: Well, why not? Word is he has Guild connections - that means Guild gold, nothing he can report stolen.

AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_10.speaker: Cashguard Basher Karol
AD_UpperOfficeGuards_Convo_10.text: You need to get wise, young one. Pretty alone doesn't last.

Clerk_001_0.speaker: Clerk Chervis
Clerk_001_0.text: Please - all the good stuff's downstairs!
Clerk_001_0.context: NodeContext: cowering while bank alarm goes off

AD_HeadClerk_Idle_0.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
AD_HeadClerk_Idle_0.text: Just balance the book and move on like always, Meadhoney. Nothing more valuable than a simple life...
AD_HeadClerk_Idle_0.context: NodeContext: Muttering to himself about the boss he dislikes. This is reference to his boss' membership of the criminal Guild. Meadhoney is aware, but doesn't want to get involved.

AD_HeadClerk_Idle_1.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
AD_HeadClerk_Idle_1.text: More unmarked withdrawals. You could at least try to hide the Guild accounts, Glitterbeard...
AD_HeadClerk_Idle_1.context: NodeContext: Muttering to himself about the boss he dislikes. This is reference to his boss' membership of the criminal Guild. Meadhoney is aware, but doesn't want to get involved.

AD_HeadClerk_Idle_2.speaker: Head Clerk Meadhoney
AD_HeadClerk_Idle_2.text: Take your time down there, Head Banker. We're not busy up here at all.
AD_HeadClerk_Idle_2.context: NodeContext: Muttering to himself about the boss he dislikes

PAD_SewersFootprints_1.speaker: Player
PAD_SewersFootprints_1.text: These footprints started in the sewers.

Guard_01_0.speaker: Cashguard Basher Mofty
Guard_01_0.text: Slower'n usual, today. You might be better off sticking your coin under the mattress.

Civilian_06_0.speaker: Brid Hunley
Civilian_06_0.text: I heard about Stelmane this morning. Word of advice - when dukes start dropping like that, get your coin and get out of the city.

Civilian_06_1.speaker: Brid Hunley
Civilian_06_1.text: This will be my third loan attempt. Waukeen be with me...

Civilian_03_0.speaker: Legarioll
Civilian_03_0.text: Back of the line. I already had to sit here while they marched some big bastard past like royalty.

Civilian_03_1.speaker: Legarioll
Civilian_03_1.text: There's a line. Order. If we can't keep that much, then we deserve to fall to some cult army.

PrivateGuard_01_0.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Morra
PrivateGuard_01_0.text: Heh. Smell that? I think old Glitterbeard got a fright.

PrivateGuard_01_1.speaker: Cashguard Artillerist Morra
PrivateGuard_01_1.text: Gods above, the Stone Lord up close.

PAD_PinCodePlatePressed_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PinCodePlatePressed_0.text: Step on a plate, trigger a light above that door. A code.

LobbyMainGuard_5.speaker: Cashguard Captain Faril
LobbyMainGuard_5.context: NodeContext: Back to neutral, bored guard

LobbyMainGuard_11.speaker: Cashguard Captain Faril
LobbyMainGuard_11.text: Account-holders only from here. Vault pass?
LobbyMainGuard_11.context: NodeContext: Utterly bored, staring straight ahead - looking for our pass to enter the vaults

LobbyMainGuard_19.speaker: Cashguard Captain Faril
LobbyMainGuard_19.text: Eh. Wait. Welcome back, my lord.
LobbyMainGuard_19.context: NodeContext: Slightly perturbed - this guard has seen Minsc pass down into the vaults before, but never come out again. Minsc now going down again - but the guard knows better than to question important customers.

LobbyMainGuard_54.speaker: Minsc
LobbyMainGuard_54.text: Minsc is no lord. Unless... Boo, do you have an account down here? Hah, were your cheeks not ample enough?
LobbyMainGuard_54.context: NodeContext: A bank guard is intimidated by Minsc, remembering him as the Stone Lord. Minsc is non-plussed, and assuming 'my lord' refers to Boo.

LobbyMainGuard_29.speaker: Player
